sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy accuses Russia of weaponizing everything from food to energy to children in its war against Ukraine during his address to the United Nations General Assembly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Azerbaijan launches a so-called anti-terrorist operation in the Nagorno-Karabakh region, sparking fears of renewed conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Critics of the EU's plans aimed at preventing online child abuse say it's a major violation of people's privacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A major slowdown in German manufacturing is dragging down Europe's economic growth, according to projections from the OECD.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: With Russia in the spotlight, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky took to the podium at the annual United Nations General Assembly in New York.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In his first direct address to the body since the start of Russia's full-scale invasion of his country last year, Zelensky slammed Moscow's actions and the threat its nuclear arsenal posed to his nation and the world. Terrorists have no right to hold nuclear weapons, no right. But truly not the nukes are the scariest now. While nukes remain in place, the mass destruction is gaining its momentum. Zelenskyy then accused Russia of blackmailing the globe with food. And it is a clear Russia's attempt to weaponize the food shortage on the global market in exchange for recognition for some, if not all, of the captured territories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He also highlighted the energy crisis and the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia, something he labeled a genocide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Zelensky said he would present the details of his peace plan to the Security Council on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: U.S. President Joe Biden has called on world leaders to stand up to what he called Russian aggression and to continue to support Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Speaking at the United Nations General Assembly in New York, Biden said if Russia's invasion was not opposed by the world community, no nation's sovereignty would be secure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia believes that the world will grow weary and allow it to brutalize Ukraine without consequence. But I ask you this, if we abandon the core principles of the United States to appease an aggressor, can any member state in this body feel confident that they are protected. If we allow Ukraine to be carved up, is the independence of any nation secure? I'd respectfully suggest the answer is no.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: War in Ukraine is far from the world's only crisis. The United Nations Secretary General invoked a host of other urgent challenges facing humanity. Our world is becoming unhinged. Geopolitical tensions are rising. Global challenges are mounting and we seem incapable of coming together to respond. We confront a host of existential threats from the climate crisis to disruptive technologies and we do so at the time of chaotic transition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This year's UN General Assembly, the world body's 78th, runs until September 26.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Renewed fighting in the Nagorno-Karabakh region on Tuesday after Azerbaijan's military shelled Armenian positions in what Baku has described as an anti-terrorist operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: At least two civilians were killed and 23 wounded by heavy artillery fire around the region's capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The clashes began after two civilians and four Azeri policemen were killed in landmine explosions in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Azerbaijan said it was ready to negotiate if Karabakh Armenian forces surrendered while Moscow called for calm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Russian side is insistently calling on the conflicting sides to stop bloodshed, to stop military action and to return to the path of diplomatic policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The president of the European Council, Charles Michel, called on Baku to immediately stop its military actions to allow for a genuine dialogue with the Karabakh Armenians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Armenia and Azerbaijan have fought two wars over the region since the fall of the Soviet Union 30 years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In the early 1990s, the conflict resulted in over 30,000 deaths and Armenian control over the territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In 2022, after a six-week war, Azerbaijan gained control of a third of Nagorno.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Greek MEP Eva Kiley is challenging the Belgian justice system. Through her lawyers,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: she claims that the country's police and secret services violated her parliamentary immunity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The former European Parliament vice president, who was arrested last December for participating in a corruption scandal linked to non-EU countries, including Qatar, is not the only one who has taken legal action against the Belgian justice system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The two other MEPs involved in the scandal have also appealed, Italian MEP Andrea Cozzolino and Belgian MEP Mark Tarabella.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: If they are vindicated, the whole case could collapse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: On Tuesday in Brussels, the first hearing took place in the now familiar Palais de Justice. Οι ενστάσεις αυτές στηρίζονται σε δύο πυλώνες. Ο ένας είναι ότι παραβιάστηκε το δικαίωμα στην ασυλία που έχει η κυρία Καϊλή από τις μυστικές εκκλησίες του Βελγίου.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Γι' αυτό επάγεται απόλυτη ακυρώντα της προδικασίας.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Και η δεύτερη και βασικότερη ένσταση είναι ότι ο ανακριτής της υπόθεσης, ο κύριος Μισελ Κλες, είχε σοβαρό κόλλημα για να μην είναι ανακριτής.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Και το απέκρυψε αυτό το κόλλημα. Ava Kali was released from prison in April and is active once again in the European Parliament, acting as an independent MEP while she awaits trial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: High interest rates and persistent inflation are dragging down Europe's growth prospects,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: particularly in Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, or OECD, has released its interim projections for the rest of this year and next. The euro area remains on course for a modest expansion of 0.6% in 2023, but it's being held back by a slowdown in German manufacturing. Globally, the prospects for manufacturing look weak and while the outlook is still positive for services, it has deteriorated since May.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We see large differences across countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The outlook is stronger in the US than it is in Europe and across both areas companies now expect less activity than they did six months ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There's significant divergence within the Eurozone's main economies. While Germany's growth is forecast to fall 0.2%, Spain will surge by 2.3% and France and Italy will see slight gains. Falling energy prices are boosting growth globally, with the US and some emerging countries performing well in 2023.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But China's stagnant economy is expected to restrict growth around the world next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Clean up online.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That was the slogan chanted by demonstrators in Brussels who demanded swift E.U. action to adopt the child sexual abuse regulation, also known as chat control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The activists wore hazmat suits and were holding cleaning materials, symbolizing the Internet being a dirty and dangerous place for kids in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Some demonstrators of the NGO Brave Movement were themselves victims of sexual abuse in their childhood.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Now they want the E.U EU to act against online sexual predators, grooming and the harassment of children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: One in five children, one in five of your children, will be sexually abused before the age of 15 or 16.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And a lot of them, it will be online.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And unfortunately, Europe at the moment hosts 60 percent of the world sexual abuse online.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Check Control Act would require big tech companies to scan for and detect child sexual abuse material, even in private encrypted messages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While some member states remain critical of the issue, activists call on the E.U. not to water down the legislation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is really a legislation that can protect the children online. Online and the online community is constantly growing because of the technology and the tech companies expanding.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And we don't know what the future holds. This is so new. All of the new technology, social media that has come to fruition in my childhood, We don't know how that affects the children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And this legislation would protect the children now, but also in the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But the Check Control Act has provoked backlash among pro-privacy activists and NGOs across Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In an open letter, they warned that in its current form, the law would allow the scanning of people's messages, violating in the process the rights of hundreds of millions of Europeans. One researcher tells Euronews that she hopes the law will fail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: ANA MARIA, The technology will not only look for child pornography. When the technology is there to look for something, we know that it will be used for other things, right, because you can check anything. Once the mechanism is in place, governments, big tech, hackers that actually hack into systems, which is something that we also know happened, can actually use this hole to check into our communications.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: EU member states will discuss the chat control act at the end of September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The European Parliament will also discuss it in October with a possible vote on the issue later this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Manchester United are set to face Bayern Munich in a highly anticipated Champions League clash at the Allianz Arena on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: United, who have had a turbulent start to their Premier League season with three losses in their first five games will desperately be looking to bounce back, but with Harry Kane leading the German attack, this game could further test Eric Ten Hag's early season expectations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Jadon Sancho didn't train with the first team as his fallout with the manager continues, whilst Bayern boss Thomas Tuchel will be serving a touchline ban.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: These two sides have met 11 times in the Champions League, with the Bavarians yet to lose at home against their English rivals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In the other games, Arsenal will be looking to get their Champions League campaign off to a winning start when they lock horns with PSV Eindhoven in London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In Group C, Real Madrid welcome Union Berlin at the Bernabeu, whilst Sporting Bragger will face a tough test against Napoli in their in-form strike of Victor Osserman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And after 10 years away from Europe's top competition, Real Sociedad will lock horns with last year's finalists Inter Milan, who should have the mental edge in Spain after thumping arch-rivals AC Milan 5-1 in Serie A.
